phaseBanner.content: This is a new service – your feedback (opens in new tab) will help us to improve it.

shared.contactLinkText: Contact the GOV.UK One Login team (opens in a new tab)

cookieBanner.title: Cookies on GOV.UK One Login
cookieBanner.heading: Cookies on GOV.UK One Login
cookieBanner.paragraph1: We use some essential cookies to make this service work.
cookieBanner.paragraph2: We’d like to set additional cookies so we can remember your settings, understand how people use the service and make improvements.

cookieBannerAccept.paragraph1: You’ve accepted additional cookies. You can

cookieBannerReject.paragraph1: You’ve rejected additional cookies. You can

contentLicence.linkText: All content is available under the Open Government Licence v3.0, except where otherwise stated

content.paragraph1: We cannot find the page you’re looking for.
content.paragraph2: If you typed the web address, check it’s correct.
content.paragraph3: If you pasted the web address, check you copied the entire address.
content.paragraph4: You can also go back to the service you were trying to use and start again. You can look for the service using your search engine or find it from the GOV.UK homepage.

content.paragraph1: Go back to the service you were trying to use and start again. You can look for the service using your search engine or find it from the GOV.UK homepage.
You cannot go back if you’ve already started entering information to prove your identity online.

pyiNoMatch.title: Sorry, we cannot prove your identity
pyiNoMatch.header: Sorry, we cannot prove your identity

content.paragraph1: We could not find a match when we checked your details with another organisation.
content.paragraph2: To keep your information safe, we cannot tell you which of your details we were unable to match.
content.paragraph3: Continue to the service you were trying to use and look for other ways to prove your identity.

pyiEscape.title: Find another way to prove your identity
pyiEscape.header: Find another way to prove your identity

content.subHeading: What would you like to do?

formRadioButtons.otherWayButtonText: Continue to the service you were trying to use to look for other ways to prove your identity
formRadioButtons.restartButtonText: Start again and try to prove your identity online with GOV.UK One Login

pyiTimeoutRecoverable.title: You have been signed out of your GOV.UK One Login
pyiTimeoutRecoverable.header: You have been signed out of your GOV.UK One Login

content.paragraph1: This could be because:
content.bullet1: you signed in over 2 hours ago
content.bullet2: you signed out while you were using another service
content.bullet3: more than one browser (for example Chrome, Safari) was used
content.paragraph2: Go back to the service you were trying to use and start again.

pyiTimeoutUnrecoverable.title: You have been signed out of your GOV.UK One Login
pyiTimeoutUnrecoverable.header: You have been signed out of your GOV.UK One Login

content.paragraph1: This could be because:
content.bullet1: you signed in over 2 hours ago
content.bullet2: you signed out while you were using another service
content.bullet3: more than one browser (for example Chrome, Safari) was used
content.paragraph2: Go back to the service you were trying to use and start again. You can look for the service using your search engine or find it from the GOV.UK homepage.

content.paragraph1: We cannot prove your identity right now.
content.paragraph2: Continue to the service you were trying to use and look for other ways to prove your identity.

content.paragraph1: We cannot prove your identity right now.
content.paragraph2: Go back to the service you were trying to use and start again. You can look for the service using your search engine or find it from the GOV.UK homepage.

pyiKbvFail.title: Sorry, we cannot prove your identity
pyiKbvFail.header: Sorry, we cannot prove your identity

content.paragraph1: This is because you did not answer some of the security questions correctly.
content.paragraph2: To keep your information safe, we cannot tell you what these questions were or what the answers should have been.
content.paragraph3: Continue to the service you were trying to use and look for other ways to prove your identity.

pyiKbvThinFile.title: You need to prove your identity another way
pyiKbvThinFile.header: You need to prove your identity another way

content.paragraph1: Our security questions are based on information held by another organisation. This organisation does not have much information about you.
content.paragraph2: This means we cannot ask you enough questions to be sure that you are who you say you are.
content.paragraph3: Continue to the service you were trying to use and look for other ways to prove your identity.

pageIpvIdentityStart.title: Start proving your identity with GOV.UK One Login
pageIpvIdentityStart.header: Start proving your identity with GOV.UK One Login

content.paragraph1: First, you will be asked some questions to find the best way to prove your identity.

pagePreKbvTransition.title: Answer security questions

content.paragraph1: We’ll ask you some security questions that only you should know the answers to. This will help us stop anyone else who might have your details from pretending to be you.
content.paragraph2: The questions will be about things like your mobile phone contract, bank account, and any credit cards, loans or mortgages you have.
content.paragraph3: We will not keep your answers.

pagePreKbvTransition.warningTextContent: Try to answer these questions as accurately as you can. You will not be able to change your answers if you make a mistake.
pagePreKbvTransition.summaryText: How we know what questions to ask you
pagePreKbvTransition.summaryHtml:
We’ll work with Experian (opens in a new tab) to make sure we ask you questions that only you can answer. This is because companies like Experian have access to lots of information that we can check your answers against.

Read our privacy notice (opens in a new tab) if you’d like to know more about how your details will be used to prove your identity.

pageF2fHandoff.title: Go to the Post Office within 10 days to finish proving your identity
pageF2fHandoff.panelText: Go to the Post Office within 10 days to finish proving your identity

content.paragraph1: You’ve been sent a confirmation email with a link to download your Post Office customer letter.
content.paragraph2: To finish proving your identity, you need to go to your chosen Post Office within the next 10 days.
content.subHeading1: What you need to take to the Post Office
content.paragraph3: When you go to the Post Office, make sure to take your:
content.bullet2: Post Office customer letter (you can download your letter from your confirmation email)
content.paragraph4: You’ll need to show your Post Office customer letter on your phone or tablet, or take a printed copy with you.
content.paragraph5: A member of Post Office staff will scan your photo ID and take a photo of you.
content.paragraph6: You’ll find details of your chosen Post Office in your customer letter. But you can
content.paragraph6LinkText: go to any Post Office that offers in-branch verification (opens in new tab)
content.insetText: If you do not go to the Post Office within the next 10 days, you’ll need to start proving your identity again.
content.subHeading3: After you’ve been to the Post Office
content.paragraph7: You’ll get an email about the result of your identity check – usually within a day of going to the Post Office.

pageDcmawSuccess.title: We’ve successfully matched you to the photo on your ID
pageDcmawSuccess.header: We’ve successfully matched you to the photo on your ID

content.paragraph1: You’ll need to enter your current home address (and previous address, if you’ve recently moved) when you continue.

pagePassportDocCheck.title: Enter your passport details and answer security questions
pagePassportDocCheck.header: Enter your passport details and answer security questions

content.paragraph1: To prove your identity this way, you’ll need:
content.bullet1: your UK passport details (including your name, passport number and the date your passport expires)
content.bullet2: your current home address (you might also need your previous address if you’ve recently moved)
content.bullet3: to answer some questions that only you should know the answers to
content.subHeading: What would you like to do?

formRadioButtons.continueButtonText: Continue to prove your identity this way
formRadioButtons.otherWayButtonHint: Continue to the service you want to use and look for other ways to prove your identity

pageMultipleDocCheck.title: Enter the details from your photo ID and answer security questions
pageMultipleDocCheck.header: Enter the details from your photo ID and answer security questions

content.paragraph1: To prove your identity, you’ll need to:
content.bullet1: enter the details from your UK driving licence or UK passport (you might find it easier to do this if you have the photo ID you want to use with you)
content.bullet2: enter your current home address (and your previous address if you’ve recently moved)
content.bullet3: answer some questions that only you should know the answers to
content.subHeading: Which photo ID would you like to use?

pageIpvReuse.title: You have already proved your identity
pageIpvReuse.header: You have already proved your identity

content.paragraph1: You proved your identity when you used GOV.UK One Login before. You will not need to do it again to use this service.
content.paragraph2: If you have not signed in to GOV.UK One Login in a while, you might want to check your details are still correct.

updateUserDetailsInformation.updateDetailsHtml: You can contact the GOV.UK One Login team (opens in a new tab) to update your details.

pageIpvPending.title: You have not finished proving your identity
pageIpvPending.header: You have not finished proving your identity

content.paragraph1: You need to go to a Post Office that offers in-branch verification to finish proving your identity.
content.paragraph2: You should have received a confirmation email explaining what to take with you and what will happen at the Post Office. Check the letter attached to your confirmation email.
content.insetText: If you'd prefer not to go to the Post Office, you can
content.subHeading: If you've already been to the Post Office
content.paragraph3: Your identity check is still being processed.
content.paragraph4: You'll get an email when there's a result for your identity check - usually within a day of going to the Post Office.

pageIpvSuccess.title: Continue to the service you want to use
pageIpvSuccess.header: Continue to the service you want to use

content.paragraph1: You’ve successfully proved your identity. You can now continue to the service you want to use.
content.paragraph2: Some of the information you shared when you proved your identity might be used to automatically fill in forms within the service.

pageIpvIdentityDocumentStart.title: Prove your identity online with the following documents
pageIpvIdentityDocumentStart.header: Prove your identity online with the following documents

content.paragraph1: You can use a UK driving licence if it:
content.paragraph2: It can be full or provisional UK driving licence.
content.paragraph3: You can use any UK passport. If your UK passport has expired, you can still use it to prove your identity up to 18 months after its expiry date.
content.subHeading3: Non-UK passport with a biometric chip
content.paragraph4: You can use a non-UK passport if it:
content.paragraph5: To check if your passport has a biometric chip, look for the rectangular biometric chip symbol on the front cover.
content.paragraph6: You can use a biometric resident permit (BRP) that has not expired.
content.subHeading5: Do you have any of these documents?

pageIpvIdentityPostofficeStart.title: You may be able to prove your identity at a Post Office if you have one of the following documents
pageIpvIdentityPostofficeStart.header: You may be able to prove your identity at a Post Office if you have one of the following documents

content.paragraph1: You can use an EU driving licence if:
content.list1: it is a plastic photocard, not a paper or handwritten licence
content.list3: the address on it is the same as your current address (if it has an address)
content.paragraph2: You can use a passport from any country, as long as it has not expired.
content.subHeading3: National identity card from a European Economic Area (EEA) country
content.paragraph3: You can use a national identity card from any country in the European Economic Area (EEA), except Denmark.
content.paragraph4: You can use an EEA national identity card if:
content.list4: it is a plastic photocard, not a paper or handwritten card
content.list5: the address on it is the same as your current address (if it has an address)
content.subHeading4: Do you have any of these documents?
